meanings.definition: Having currents of cool air flowing in
meanings.sent1: The old house was drafty, with chilly breezes coming through the windows.
meanings.sent2: She put on a sweater to stay warm in the drafty room.
meanings.sent3: The drafty room made the candles flicker, creating a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The drafty attic whispered secrets as the wind whistled through the cracks.
meanings.sent5: The drafty barn felt like a freezer, even in the middle of summer.

meanings.definition: A preliminary version of a document or plan
meanings.sent1: He quickly sketched out a drafty of his speech before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The team reviewed the drafty of the proposal before finalizing it.
meanings.sent3: The drafty of the novel was full of errors, but the final version was polished.
meanings.sent4: Her drafty for the new project was innovative and well-received by the team.
meanings.sent5: The drafty of the map helped them plan their route through the forest.
